tagged_story_for_tts:
1942.11.27 – Seattle, USA: Self-taught left-handed guitarist flipping right-handed Strats upside-down, redefining electric blues with feedback, wah, and psychedelia at Monterey (1967), Woodstock (1969)—Star-Spangled Banner as anti-war protest: 3 albums in 4 years (Are You Experienced, Axis: Bold as Love, Electric Ladyland). 1970.09.18 – London, UK: Choked on vomit, aged 27, buried in Seattle—posthumous legend: Rolling Stone’s #1 guitarist ever, $30M+ annual estate, inspiration for Prince, Stevie Ray Vaughan, Lenny Kravitz.

For further exploring: psychedelic rock, guitar innovation, 27 Club. <[silence:
